授業目的: Building on Reading I, this course aims to improve English reading skills and build vocabulary knowledge. In intensive reading, students will read nonfiction articles with a focus on improving both general understanding and specific reading skills. The course will also provide other reading opportunities, including readings aimed at improving reading fluency without the aid of dictionaries (“extended readings”) and readings to extend reading skills and knowledge of previously studied materials.
到達目標: At the end of the semester, students should be able to:  - use specific reading skills and general comprehension to understand readings- be able to read both longer texts and shorter intensive texts more fluently- understand vocabulary frequently used for nonfiction articles.

授業の概要・背景: The Course Outline will be provided at the beginning of the semester, including the weekly schedule and assessments.
授業方法: Students are requested to prepare for each class. Classes are conducted in English and students are encouraged to use English in class. Students often do group activities during class. Our class will meet on campus each week, as conditions permit. Notification will be given if a class needs to be moved online.

トピック.授業計画1:
A Course Outline with more details will be provided at the beginning of the semester. Basically, students will go through the following activities.
1. Weekly reading practice and vocabulary learning by using the textbook.
2. Extensive reading (outside class) 4 times per semester.
3. Occasional vocabulary tests, and two reading tests during the semester.
4. Occasional homework to be brought into class in the following week.
トピック.授業外学習2:
1. Students are requested to prepare for each lesson as instructed in the Course Outline.
2. Students are requested to read 4 Graded Readers books and other reading materials.
